Description: String of twelve beads: ten glass eye beads, probably rod-formed with trailed white details; one plain red glass or paste bead, depressed biconical in shape, and one small barrel- or seed-shaped example; two of the eye-beads have broken into several pieces two; surfaces very worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.116, Tomb 18)
